meanings.def: something that can be measured and used as a standard that other things can be compared with
examples: Tests at the age of seven provide a benchmark against which the child's progress at school can be measured.
It sets a benchmark for future improvements.
The German recycling system is seen as a benchmark for schemes throughout Europe.
The central bank has cut its benchmark interest rate four times.

meanings.def: to judge the quality of something in relation to that of other similar things
examples: Projects are assessed and benchmarked against the targets.
The journal was recently benchmarked against other IT journals.
